intro: Stichorkis kempteriana, commonly known as the Kempter's stichorkis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
